intro: Koanophyllon polystictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Koanophyllon polystictum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert regions.
